title: City completes cleanup of homeless encampment considered ‘health and safety concern’
description: After months of work, a local city said it has finished removing what it called a health and safety concern.

After months of work, a local city said it has finished removing what it called a health and safety concern.

News Center 7’s John Bedell spoke to city officials about the cleanup. He will have the latest LIVE on News Center 7 at 5:30.

Tom Gates’ family has been in the glass business for 78 years and has had an office in Springfield for nearly half that time.
• None Owner of dog that attacked 89-year-old, killed pet speaks out
• None Several astronomical events to be visible from Miami Valley,

His office has a view of the homeless encampment that is right across the railroad tracks.

Lately, he has watched city crews clear it out.

The city said it’s currently working on long-term solutions with the community:

“Addressing homelessness requires a collaborative effort,” Logan Cobbs, Director of Community Development in Springfield, said. “Local governments, nonprofits, service providers, and the community all have a role to play. We all must work together to find lasting solutions. No single entity can solve the problem alone. While immediate action, like supporting individuals in encampments, is important, we must also focus on long-term solutions such as increasing affordable housing, providing more mental health resources, and building a more resilient support system for those at risk of homelessness. That’s what we, as a community, are currently working on.”

We will update this story.
summary: A local city has completed its cleanup of a homeless encampment deemed a health and safety concern after months of work. Yahoo is using AI to generate takeaways from this article, which may not always match what's in the article but helps improve the user experience. The city is currently working on long-term solutions to the issue, including increasing affordable housing, providing more mental health resources, and building a more resilient support system for those at risk of homelessness.
shortSummary: A Springfield city has cleared a homeless encampment deemed a health and safety concern, focusing on long-term solutions, using AI to generate takeaways from inaccurate information.
argos_summary: The city has completed the removal of a homeless encampment, which was deemed a health and safety concern. City officials emphasize the need for a collaborative approach to address homelessness, involving local governments, nonprofits, and the community to develop long-term solutions such as affordable housing and mental health resources. Updates on the situation will be provided as they become available.
